t: Isaiah 2
The Future House of God
The*p word that Isaiah the son of Amoz saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem.

Now*pn it shall come to pass in the latter days That*ild the mountain of the Lord’s*s house Shall*ld be established on the top of the mountains, And*ld shall be exalted above the hills; And*ld all nations shall flow to it.

Many*ld people shall come and say, “Come,*ld and let us go up to the mountain of the Lord,*s To*ld the house of the God of Jacob; He*ld will teach us His ways, And*ld we shall walk in His paths.” For*ld out of Zion shall go forth the law, And*ld the word of the Lord*s from Jerusalem.

He*ld shall judge between the nations, And*ld rebuke many people; They*ld shall beat their swords into plowshares, And*ld their spears into pruning hooks; Nation*ld shall not lift up sword against nation, Neither*ld shall they learn war anymore.
The Day of the Lord
O*pn house of Jacob, come and let us walk In*ld the light of the Lord.*s

For*ln You have forsaken Your people, the house of Jacob, Because*ld they are filled with eastern ways; They*ld are*i soothsayers like the Philistines, And*ld they are pleased with the children of foreigners.
Their*ld land is also full of silver and gold, And*ld there is no end to their treasures; Their*ld land is also full of horses, And*ld there is no end to their chariots.
Their*ld land is also full of idols; They*ld worship the work of their own hands, That*ld which their own fingers have made.
People*ld bow down, And*ld each man humbles himself; Therefore*ld do not forgive them.
Enter*ln into the rock, and hide in the dust, From*ld the terror of the Lord*s And*ld the glory of His majesty.
The*ld lofty looks of man shall be humbled, The*ld haughtiness of men shall be bowed down, And*ld the Lord*s alone shall be exalted in that day.
For*ln the day of the Lord*s of hosts Shall*ild come*i upon everything proud and lofty, Upon*ld everything lifted up— And*ld it shall be brought low—
Upon*ld all the cedars of Lebanon that*i are*i high and lifted up, And*ld upon all the oaks of Bashan;
Upon*ld all the high mountains, And*ld upon all the hills that*i are*i lifted up;
Upon*ld every high tower, And*ld upon every fortified wall;
Upon*ld all the ships of Tarshish, And*ld upon all the beautiful sloops.
The*ld loftiness of man shall be bowed down, And*ld the haughtiness of men shall be brought low; The*ld Lord*s alone will be exalted in that day,
But*ld the idols He shall utterly abolish.
They*ln shall go into the holes of the rocks, And*ld into the caves of the earth, From*ld the terror of the Lord*s And*ld the glory of His majesty, When*ld He arises to shake the earth mightily.
In*ln that day a man will cast away his idols of silver And*ld his idols of gold, Which*ld they made, each*i for himself to worship, To*ld the moles and bats,
To*ld go into the clefts of the rocks, And*ld into the crags of the rugged rocks, From*ld the terror of the Lord*s And*ld the glory of His majesty, When*ld He arises to shake the earth mightily.
Sever*ln yourselves from such a man, Whose*ld breath is*i in his nostrils; For*ld of what account is he?
